popt4jlib
Interface LocalOptimizerIntf

All Superinterfaces:
OptimizerIntf, java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AlternatingVariablesDescent, ArmijoBFGS, ArmijoSteepestDescent, ArmijoSteepestDescentST, DLS, FletcherConjugateGradient, FletcherConjugateGradientST, IdentitySearchOptimizer, PolakRibiereConjugateGradient, PolakRibiereConjugateGradientST, RandomDescents
public interface LocalOptimizerIntf
extends OptimizerIntf, java.io.Serializable

interface for local-optimization methods (methods seeking a local minimum in the neighborhood of a "starting point" solution). Extends the java.io.Serializable interface so that implementing objects can be transported across JVMs in distributed computation.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2017

Company:

Version:
2.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

minimize
 

Method Detail

newInstance

public LocalOptimizerIntf newInstance()
create and return a new (empty) instance of the implementing object, that will need to set its parameters first before invoking the OptimizerIntf's minimize(f) method.

Returns:
LocalOptimizerIntf

getParams

public java.util.HashMap getParams()
get a copy of this object's parameters.

Returns:
HashMap may be null

setParams

public void setParams(java.util.HashMap params)
               throws OptimizerException
set this object's parameters needed for the optimization process. The parameter set must always contain a starting point from which to start the local optimization process (with key that is usually "[X.]x0" where X is an abbreviated name of the method employed).

Parameters:
params - HashMap
Throws:
OptimizerException
